channel.title: Ssh on smk's Blogs
channel.description: Recent content in Ssh on smk's Blogs

item.title: ssh
item.description: Generate a keypair for server-side user accounts #!/bin/bash -e rlwrap ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 2048 Do not specify password for keypair Additionally rename your keys something sensible! id_ed25519 : Private key id_ed25519.pub : Public key Now as a good practice rename keys according to server. For example : smk.prvkey and smk.pubkey Never share your private key. Never ever never! smk.pubkey should be appended to "$HOME/.
